Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: Hi Squirrel I have gone down the reverse route - had the TAX first and now on the FEC.  The TAX will affect people in different ways, unfortunately for me the first one hit me hard - but I got through the otherside and within a week of having it I started to feel a little better.  The 2nd/3rd dose wasn't as bad as I think I got used to it!  I got the doctor to prescribe me some Cordysol mouthwash which helped a lot with mouth problems.  I also got told to moisturise your hands, feet and nails with cream to help with the skin/nail problems (which was too late for me as they look like a manicurist worst nightmare!) Make sure you listen to your body and rest as much as you can  Take care
Posts.Title: 2 more FEC then 4 tax, i am in pieces worrying

Posts.Content: Hi Tracey You aren't alone - I am struggling too... I was booked in to have a bilateral mastectomy on the 28th February but today the hospital has phoned up and brought the operation forward to the 21st Feb.   Sending you a big hug Kat
